author: vic

review: I have a Roku 3 and love it.  I wanted a second one for the other room, but I thought...I'll give the Chromecast a shot, for 25$ I'm not expecting much.  Well, it's a bit flaky at times.  Some of the apps from Android and/or Apple tend to be a bit unstable on the Chromecast.  The sound sometimes isn't synced with the video properly.  There aren't that many apps availabe for the Chromecast either.  All things considered, the Chromecast works pretty good for what it is.  But I love my Roku more than this item.
author: RyanP

review: Not only does it work as well and as easy as advertised,  the picture quality exceeded expectations. I would recommend this item to everyone.

review: Streaming data to your big screen tv... a great idea.  Great for Netflix and  UTube.  Would like to stream my photos from my C:/ but doing so is very cumbersome.  Have not really mastered the technique.  Also issuing commands from your tablet to the Chromecast seems prone to fail.  I keep getting a "time out"  then a "unable to issue command to this device 160001.  failure.However having better luck with my NetBook.  I will get back to you should the situation improve.

review: The hookup was easy (added the extender cable to get better reception)It would have been greater if it could work with your browser not just Hulu plus,  netflix and YoutubeNot so easy to disengage once you start  a movie in netflix. Either Netflix is the issue or Chromecast is because once you switch it back to your tablet and go back to browsing movies the Netflix thinks its still running the first movie. Then you have to  cycle off the Chromecast hdmi port to disengage the casted movie .But for $35 it is nice not to need an HDMI cable connected.
